label: 大日本史
本: The Cambridge History of Japan, Volume 4:  Early Modern Japan . Cambridge University Press . 1991
説明文: [One of the major historical works of the early Edo period] compiled under the auspices of the Mito domain, [it] employed the kiden style, consisting of annals, biographies, and treatises....  The Dai Nihon shi was begun in 1657 at the direction of Tokugawa Mitsukuni (1628-1700), the second lord of the Mito domain.  The work, in 397 volumes, was completed only in 1906 (p. 409). [水戸、紀伝、徳川光圀]
